messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: UNSCHOOLING! Our First Day.. Forgot a biggie!
messages.msgSnippet: I really like this idea of wrapping just about anything.  WHAT FUN! Kristen ... From: SandraDodd@aol.com To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com Sent: Tuesday,
messages.messageBody:
I really like this idea of wrapping just about anything. WHAT FUN!

Kristen
----- Original Message -----
From: SandraDodd@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, December 17, 2002 1:20 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: UNSCHOOLING! Our First Day.. Forgot a biggie!



In a message dated 12/17/02 9:17:05 AM, mummyone24@... writes:

<< One
wrapped the milk and the other wrapped the cereal. They wer so happy with
themselves!!!
>>

Hey! They stole my idea! (I mean we both thought of the same goofy fun!)

I loved (LOVED) opening gifts as a kid. One thing my mom did every Christmas
was to buy us new school supplies, and wrap them. So after Christmas I had a
new box of crayons, new erasers, pencils, glue, maybe a ruler, maybe
notebooks...

Sandra

In a message dated 12/17/02 11:17:16 AM Eastern Standard Time,
mummyone24@... writes:

> That's too funny. I was watching a Will and Grace a couple of weeks ago and
> Will turned the bedroom into a gift wrapping center. Him and his gay guy
> friend (don't know his name) were exchanging gifts in the morning. One

> themselves!!!

>
>

I saw that! That was funny. His friend is Jack.
Elissa

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: UNSCHOOLING! Our First Day.. Forgot a biggie!
messages.messageBody:
>From: SandraDodd@...

<<Also you might wrap up other things, just for fun. His lunch. I don't
know.>>


That's too funny. I was watching a Will and Grace a couple of weeks ago and
Will turned the bedroom into a gift wrapping center. Him and his gay guy
friend (don't know his name) were exchanging gifts in the morning. One
wrapped the milk and the other wrapped the cereal. They wer so happy with
themselves!!!

Mary B
